title: Fundy National Park Offers Workshops for Taste of Fundy EventTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Fundy National Park Offers Workshops for Taste of Fundy Event
To complement the regional Taste of Fundy event, Parks Canada invites visitors to Fundy National Park on September 12th for two outdoor cooking classes – The Rustic Gourmet’s Kitchen – in the Herring Cove’s picnic area.
Join renowned Chef Dennis Johnston, former co-owner and chef of Halifax’s Fid Resto, as he leads the culinary workshops. Information will include packing food items for an overnight camping trip and maintaining healthy eating habits for your family during outdoor vacations.
Both two-hour workshops include engaging demonstrations and tastings with delicious recipes. The event also incorporates the Rustic Gourmet’s Toolkit, available for purchase, which is a handy mix of spices and sauces, sure to transform any dish from drab to delectable.
Quick Facts
The first workshop, featuring Breakfast burrito with Pico de Gallo, will run from noon to 2 p.m. The second workshop, featuring a Thai-inspired dish called kao soi, will be held from 3 p.m.to 5 p.m.
Classes are limited to 20 participants each. Cost is $22 per person. Participants can pre-register by calling 506-887-6000.
Spearheaded by NB Tourism, the Taste of Fundy event partners include the Fundy Trail Parkway, Fundy National Park, Cape Enrage and the Hopewell Rocks, and also many local restaurants located within the Fundy region.
Source:- Parks Canada
